intro: Lourteigia fimbriata, commonly known as the fringed bignonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, yellow-orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with opposite, ovate leaves that have a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by hummingbirds, which are attracted to its nectar-rich blooms. Lourteigia fimbriata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
